name: unix
knowledge:
File system:
- Everything is a file (devices, sockets, pipes)
- /etc for config, /var for data, /tmp for temporary
- Permissions: rwx for user/group/other (chmod 755)
- Ownership: chown user:group file

Process management:
- ps aux: list all processes
- kill PID: graceful termination (SIGTERM)
- kill -9 PID: force kill (SIGKILL)
- nohup command &: run in background, survive logout
- systemctl: manage services

Text processing:
- grep: search text (grep -r 'pattern' /path)
- sed: stream editor (sed 's/old/new/g' file)
- awk: column processing (awk '{print $1}' file)
- find: locate files (find /path -name '*.py')
- xargs: build commands from stdin

Networking:
- netstat -tlpn: listening ports
- ss -tlpn: modern alternative
- curl: HTTP requests
- ssh: secure shell
- scp: secure copy

Disk:
- df -h: disk free space
- du -sh *: directory sizes
- lsblk: block devices
- mount/umount: attach filesystems
examples:
# Find and kill process by name
pgrep -f 'python.*core.py' | xargs kill

# Watch log file in real time
tail -f /var/log/syslog | grep --line-buffered 'error'

# Find large files
find / -type f -size +100M 2>/dev/null | head -20

# Check what's using a port
lsof -i :8080

# Safe recursive delete
find /path -name '*.pyc' -delete

# Transfer files
rsync -avz --progress src/ user@host:/dest/

# Check disk usage by directory
du -sh /* 2>/dev/null | sort -hr | head -10

# Monitor system resources
htop  # or: top -o %MEM

# Cron job (runs at 3am daily)
0 3 * * * /path/to/script.sh >> /var/log/script.log 2>&1

# Service management
systemctl status nginx
systemctl restart nginx
journalctl -u nginx -f  # follow logs
patterns:
- Always use absolute paths in scripts/cron
- Redirect both stdout and stderr (command >> log 2>&1)
- Use 'set -e' in bash scripts to fail on error
- Test destructive commands with echo first
- Use quotes around variables: "$var" not $var
- Prefer 'command || true' to ignore errors
- Use 'mktemp' for temporary files
- Check exit codes: $? or use &&/||
